alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Pope (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 15 at 12:25PM CDT until May 15 at 3:25PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Pope County in central Arkansas... Northeastern Johnson County in western Arkansas... * Until 325 PM CDT. * At 1225 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Russellville, Pottsville, Dover, London, Hector, Broomfield, Taral, Holman, Solo, Bertha, Dillen, Lake Dardanelle, Rosetta, Devils Knob, Long Pool Campground, Pleasant Valley in Pope County, Treat, Scottsville, Simpson and Lutherville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
